positive.review: Absolutely great game! One of the best in the bus game industry, great physics, sounds and a lot of mods from steam and online!

bad graphic, obsolete ui, but awesome gameplay. you got to treat it like you working in real world bus. it's not exactly the simcade like ets2, or ats cuz any button or lever in game bus works as the irl bus do (even the air conditioner, or heater work). real time, real scale map as 1:1 (1 in game km. = 1 real world km.) recommend for anyone who love bus, or wanna try driving something more challenge than many adrenaline rushing car game.
No other bus simulator will ever meet the level of realism that is provided by omsi. This is the best bus simulator and time has not affected it as thousands play it every year.
Gameplay wise is the best bus simulator, only the graphics will let you down, dlc and mod rich feature is the best.
The best bus simulation on the market. Pair it with Bus Company Simulator to upgrade your experience. Allow 20-30 hours to learn the game.

Its the FSX of bus simulators. Its old but nothing on the market gets close to the level of detail Omsi 2 has. 

If you can handle a game that looks and feels old with little to no hand holding and lots of reading manuals then Omsi 2 will give you proper bus driving. 

If you are looking for something flashy and easy to jump into this isn't for you. I would go with "The Bus" if you want something like that.

first off i run this on linux i must say it is a little stuttery and laggy but otherwise this game is fucking amazing oddly im pouring hours into this game and idek why its just fun highly recomend this game its an amazing bus simulator DO NOT BUY the modern bus games THIS GAME is perfect.
Good game for those who want to learn decently realistic bus driving
If you like driving buses then this is a game for you it is fantastic game to play.
abit glichy but there should be mor routes in nortyh london

runs smooth with high end devices

first off i run this on linux i must say it is a little stuttery and laggy but otherwise this game is fucking amazing oddly im pouring hours into this game and idek why its just fun highly recomend this game its an amazing bus simulator DO NOT BUY the modern bus games THIS GAME is perfect.

I personally love OMSI 2. For me it's just a relaxing experience BUT if you're willing to really get into modding and installing maps and busses and so on get ready for some headaches. This game is really old and so is the codebase meaning that it tends to crash a lot and if you're installing custom maps/busses and some files are not installed correctly or missing that's a pain in the a** lol.
A good game and actually fun and quite lifelike,,,,,but not very user friendly
this is the best bus game only downside is it is a 32 Bit and running on old engine but overall rating is 8/10 it has lots of mods from lost of countries and everything the community is really big

Hard to learn, worth it after you do.
The aspect of the physics, interactable interiour and other make this game pop.
10/10
very good game! realistic buses, suspension, graphics, 10/10, the game is super fun you could never get bored of it

Have played this game for years and i always come back to it.
Wish it had a little refresh now to clear a few bug or make the game/graphics run smoother

Even if you don't like busses, its a very fun driving game if your into simulators etc. In most of the busses almost every function is able to be interacted with, and there's a massive community where you can get free mods etc to make the game so much better. 

Omsi 2 is very realistic, calming, and fun to play no matter weather your into busses or not, at some points can be challenging, other times you are calmy driving. 

Some downsides is it can be quite laggy at times and crashes. Lagginess depends on the map and bus, crashing just happens randomly, but not toooo often.

Get it if you like driving, very fun
Consider getting an addon like Busbetrieb Simulator (Bus Company Simulator) for the game for added GPS and route selection to make this a top tier game. Otherwise the game gets a high 9/10 for me.

Old graphics? Yes. 
Unoptimized? Yes. 
The best physics and bus simulation? Yes. Lots of free map and bus mods? Yes. 
Still alive? Yes. 
Do I love it? Yes.

negative.review: This simulator is still engaging and immersive. However, the developers should seriously consider supporting all other aspects of the gameplay. The visuals, playability, and mechanics are lacking, and the endless addition of paid expansions lacks ambition. The lack of any free expansions is saddening. But it's the archaic engine, completely ignored, undeveloped, and not even updated for 15 years, that's its weakest point. The game engine is unstable, causes technical issues, and can't even cope with itself. Positive comments are a sham for players and a false message for the developers... Such mutual admiration leads nowhere. Do we respect each other or not? Because players are tired, and Omsi is on a slippery slope. Do I recommend this game? Absolutely. But a positive opinion requires more than just sentiment.

It was an amazing game back when it was still new. Now returning back to it, it is totally unplayable. Crashes every time you try to do anything in the game it gives you a guaranteed fatal error. It is really a shame :/
its shit ther gamers bugs its shit dotn waste ur money l devs l owner shit just shit
Someone needs to take over the game a fix it
va peor que antes

I will never understand why this game cost 40 dollars, especially most of the DLCs, I'm sorry, but this game is so damn pricey. This game is full of bugs and very complicated, especially the editor and the chicago DLC, the editor is WAY to complicated and the chicago DLC is super buggy, especially when youre making your own bus livery. And guess what? Once you buy the chicago DLC, you cna only drive TWO bus routes, just two, and you can even buy another DLC "London UK" where it cost cheaper and has 16 bus routes, and chicago dlc only has 2 and is more expensive, and yet, it cost almost the same price of the main game. And also the omni navigation, it cost 10-15 dollars for a waypoint, I mean sure, i'd say it looks pretty cool, I dont actually have it yet but ive seen it in videos and i think 10-15 dollars is way too much money for such a tiny thing. This game also has medium quality and yet, it cost 40 dollars. The devs really need to fix this game and stop being so damn pricey. And it's not just this. They recently made another game called City Bus Manager about an year ago, and its almost the same price, and it's a game where you just make your own bus routes around the world, as in graphics, its pertty low quality and you can't even drive any busses yourself, the only reason I know this even though I don't have it is because a friend of mine is addicted to it and shows me his gameplay sometimes. And i looked at other games that this company "Aerosoft" made, and guess what, most of their other games are like 30-40 dollars. Like what do they need so much money for? And no i dont expect for everything to be free, i think the price is just too high for such a buggy game.

This simulator is still engaging and immersive. However, the developers should seriously consider supporting all other aspects of the gameplay. The visuals, playability, and mechanics are lacking, and the endless addition of paid expansions lacks ambition. The lack of any free expansions is saddening. But it's the archaic engine, completely ignored, undeveloped, and not even updated for 15 years, that's its weakest point. The game engine is unstable, causes technical issues, and can't even cope with itself. Positive comments are a sham for players and a false message for the developers... Such mutual admiration leads nowhere. Do we respect each other or not? Because players are tired, and Omsi is on a slippery slope. Do I recommend this game? Absolutely. But a positive opinion requires more than just sentiment.
Took more than 30 mins to get the map to work properly, the bus to spawn, just for the bus to not move at all and game has no sound.

It was an amazing game back when it was still new. Now returning back to it, it is totally unplayable. Crashes every time you try to do anything in the game it gives you a guaranteed fatal error. It is really a shame :/
its shit ther gamers bugs its shit dotn waste ur money l devs l owner shit just shit

Archaic, outdated and impossibly inaccessible. I saw the positive reviews and decided to give it a shot. OMSI 2 is a 1:1 simulator of being a bus driver but that comes at such a significant cost of practical functionality that the game is just unplayable. Key bindings that just nebulously don't work. Tutorials that soft lock. Graphics that don't render properly. Blurry textures. Settings that make no sense. Clumsy interface. Ridiculous load times. The list goes on and on. This is a simulator in the truest sense and that's not a good thing. The game came out in 2013 but honestly looks and feels like something from at least a decade earlier. The absurd DLC model is just icing on the cake, with almost $2K of payware to fully enjoy the game, including entire maps and new buses. I don't have the time or patience to try to overcome this game's flaws and, as a general PSA, I would caution the average person to take the "very positive" steam rating with a grain of salt.
This game is sheet for launching on windows 11 and it costs 30 euros for what? Please fix this game ik its old but cmon put it free!!!!!!!
This game is not worth the money it looks like its from the 80s and feels like it. And the game doesn't even work 95% of the time. >:( WASTE OF MONEY
What a awful game. It constantly crashes, has problems with logitech wheel, it's ugly and the price is way too high.

Would not recommend
1. Game is so outdated and unpolished
2. Tutorial just doesn't work and game isn't at all optimised
3. (at least for me) Game couldn't load without crashing and having to lower all settings
Overall don't waste your money on this game
Someone needs to take over the game a fix it

This game also has medium quality and yet, it cost 40 dollars. The devs really need to fix this game and stop being so damn pricey. And it's not just this. They recently made another game called City Bus Manager about an year ago, and its almost the same price, and it's a game where you just make your own bus routes around the world, as in graphics, its pertty low quality and you can't even drive any busses yourself, the only reason I know this even though I don't have it is because a friend of mine is addicted to it and shows me his gameplay sometimes. And i looked at other games that this company "Aerosoft" made, and guess what, most of their other games are like 30-40 dollars. Like what do they need so much money for? And no i dont expect for everything to be free, i think the price is just too high for such a buggy game.

This simulator is still engaging and immersive. However, the developers should seriously consider supporting all other aspects of the gameplay. The visuals, playability, and mechanics are lacking, and the endless addition of paid expansions lacks ambition. The lack of any free expansions is saddening. But it's the archaic engine, completely ignored, undeveloped, and not even updated for 15 years, that's its weakest point. The game engine is unstable, causes technical issues, and can't even cope with itself. Positive comments are a sham for players and a false message for the developers... Such mutual admiration leads nowhere. Do we respect each other or not? Because players are tired, and Omsi is on a slippery slope. Do I recommend this game? Absolutely. But a positive opinion requires more than just sentiment.
Took more than 30 mins to get the map to work properly, the bus to spawn, just for the bus to not move at all and game has no sound.

It was an amazing game back when it was still new. Now returning back to it, it is totally unplayable. Crashes every time you try to do anything in the game it gives you a guaranteed fatal error. It is really a shame :/
its shit ther gamers bugs its shit dotn waste ur money l devs l owner shit just shit

Archaic, outdated and impossibly inaccessible. I saw the positive reviews and decided to give it a shot. OMSI 2 is a 1:1 simulator of being a bus driver but that comes at such a significant cost of practical functionality that the game is just unplayable. Key bindings that just nebulously don't work. Tutorials that soft lock. Graphics that don't render properly. Blurry textures. Settings that make no sense. Clumsy interface. Ridiculous load times. The list goes on and on. This is a simulator in the truest sense and that's not a good thing. The game came out in 2013 but honestly looks and feels like something from at least a decade earlier. The absurd DLC model is just icing on the cake, with almost $2K of payware to fully enjoy the game, including entire maps and new buses. I don't have the time or patience to try to overcome this game's flaws and, as a general PSA, I would caution the average person to take the "very positive" steam rating with a grain of salt.
This game is sheet for launching on windows 11 and it costs 30 euros for what? Please fix this game ik its old but cmon put it free!!!!!!!
This game is not worth the money it looks like its from the 80s and feels like it. And the game doesn't even work 95% of the time. >:( WASTE OF MONEY
What a awful game. It constantly crashes, has problems with logitech wheel, it's ugly and the price is way too high.

Would not recommend
1. Game is so outdated and unpolished
2. Tutorial just doesn't work and game isn't at all optimised
3. (at least for me) Game couldn't load without crashing and having to lower all settings
Overall don't waste your money on this game
